pullRequest.title: Pbf pbem remember password
pullRequest.bodyText:
Summary

Add username/password to PBEM screen

After this update the PBEM screen 'play' button can be enabled by filling in all forms found only on the PBEM screen.

Password handling on PBEM and PBF are updated to have 'remember password' buttons that will blank out the password on game exit if not selected.

Commits
commit a15d422
Update PBF & PBEM to have username+password and remember password

commit 3db45c1
Improve help text formatting

commit 17b146c
Update handling of forum password

- Do not store the password as a variable in view model
- This makes it consistent with how we handle email password
  in the PBEM view model.
- Of note, we set only a dummy text in the password field
- When password field is set, we will set the ClientSetting
  password value and then toggle a flag to indicate password
  has been set, but we will not store it as a variable.

commit 7a98d1b
Make help text fetch be consistent remove the only if statement in ForumPosterEditor constructor


Functional Changes

[] New map or map update
[] New Feature
[x] Feature update or enhancement
[] Feature Removal
[] Code Cleanup or refactor
[] Configuration Change
[x] Problem fix:  #5921, #5856 
[] Other:   
Testing

test cover is pretty good, gives confidence on the backend
play-tested the fields being set/unset to verify the label highlight and play button being enabled
play-tested password remember being remembered and/or forgotton

commit.message: Update PBF & PBEM to have username+password and remember password

Update handling of forum password

- Do not store the password as a variable in view model
- This makes it consistent with how we handle email password
  in the PBEM view model.
- Of note, we set only a dummy text in the password field
- When password field is set, we will set the ClientSetting
  password value and then toggle a flag to indicate password
  has been set, but we will not store it as a variable.
Make help text fetch be consistent remove the only if statement in ForumPosterEditor constructor
